props.name: modelValue
props.description: This is the v-model property which is an array containing the lower and upper bounds of the selected range.

props.name: ids
props.description: The list of ids for the lower bound and upper bound inputs, e.g. ['lowerBoundId', 'upperBoundId']

props.name: output
props.description: Disable output display if set to false

props.name: legend
props.description: Disable legend if set to false

props.name: tooltip
props.description: Disable tooltip if set to false

props.name: step
props.description:
The size of steps between values the user can select. Defaults to 1 unless percentage = true in which case it will
default to 0.01.

props.name: decimals
props.description: The rounding precision for display purposes

props.name: valueTemplate
props.description:
A format template string used for display purposes. Use the placeholder {value} to reference the value in the
format string. e.g. value = 90, ${value} => $90

props.name: disableFormatting
props.description: Disable formatting, e.g. in the case of a year value -> display as 2020, not 2,020.

props.name: percentage
props.description: Automatically applies % formatting, e.g. if the value = 0.15 it will be displayed as 15%

props.name: max
props.description: The maximum range value. The default value is 100 except when percentage = true the default is 1 (100%).

props.name: lowerBoundLabel
props.description: ARIA label for the lower bound slider.

props.name: upperBoundLabel
props.description: ARIA label for the upper bound slider.

events.name: update:modelValue
events.description: Event triggered when the lower or upper bounds of the value change.
